Draghi: In the measures we announced today there is confidence but there is no complacency
Constâncio: Participation of Greece in QE depends not only on conclusion of the review
Draghi: Decisions on the Greek bank recapitalisation method were decisions of the banks themselves and the government to some extent
Draghi: The reinvestment of the principal of the bond may start before March 2017 but will certainly continue after March 2017
Draghi: During the quiet period there will be no discussion on monetary policy with representative of financial institutions
Draghi: We have the effects of spillovers in mind but we are bound by our mandate
Draghi: We observed that cuts in the deposit facility rate vastly improve the transmission of monetary policy
Draghi: National central banks decide on their own investment portfolios
Draghi: We are going to review some of the technical parameters of our programme in the spring
Draghi: We had to recalibrate our measures due to changing circumstances over the summer and we will continue to do this
Draghi: The cost of credit for the euro area fell by approximately 80 bps
Draghi: There was a very large majority in favour of these measures
Draghi: Bonds we have purchased and will purchase will stay on our balance sheet for a long time
Draghi: We are doing more because it works not because it fails
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/JbpeSEwiog
Draghi: In order to reap the full benefits from our monetary policy measures, other policy areas must contribute decisively
Draghi: Projections foresee annual HICP inflation at 0.1% in 2015 (0.1% in Sept), 1.0% in 2016 (1.1%) and 1.6% in 2017 (1.7%)
Draghi: Projections foresee annual real GDP increasing by 1.5% in 2015 (1.4% in Sept), 1.7% in 2016 (1.7%) and 1.9% in 2017 (1.8%)
Draghi: Our decisions reinforce momentum of the euro area’s economic recovery and strengthen its resilience against global economic shocks
Draghi: Our new measures will ensure accommodative financial conditions and strengthen the easing impact of measures taken since June 2014
Draghi: The latest staff projections indicate continued downside risks to the inflation outlook
Draghi: Fifth, we will continue conducting the MROs and 3-month LTROs as fixed rate procedures with full allotment as long as necessary
Draghi: Fourth, we decided to include, in the PSPP, debt instruments issued by regional and local governments located in the euro area
Draghi: Third, we decided to reinvest the principal payments on the securities purchased under the APP as they mature, as long as necessary
Draghi: Second, we decided to extend the asset purchase programme until the end of March 2017, or beyond, if necessary
Draghi: First, we decided to lower the interest rate on the deposit facility by 10 basis points to -0.30%
Monetary policy decisions: deposit facility rate cut to -0.30% (minus 0.30%), MRO rate and MLF rate unchanged https://t.co/Dndob8fdEl
